original_definition: 'reactivation function' means a function facilitating the activation of other modes, including active mode, by remote switch, including remote control, internal sensor, timer to a condition providing additional functions, including the main function;
generated_definition: 'reactivation function' means a function that allows the equipment to resume its original state after a temporary stop or hibernation, characterized by a low power consumption of no more than 1,00 w in any condition.

Article 2: ‘reactivation function’ means a function facilitating the activation of other modes, including active mode, by remote switch, including remote control, internal sensor, timer to a condition providing additional functions, including the main function;

‘reactivation function’ means a function facilitating the activation of other modes, includingactive mode, by remote switch, including remote control, internal sensor, timer to a condition providing additional functions, including the main function;
reactivation function, or reactivation function and only an indication of enabled reactivation function, and/or
Article 8: The power consumption of equipment in any condition providing onlyinformation or status display, or providing only a combination ofreactivation function and information or status display shall not exceed 1,00 W.

The power consumption of equipment in any condition providing only information or status display, or providing only a combination of reactivation function and information or status display, shall not exceed 2,00 W.

The power consumption of equipment in any condition providing only a reactivation function, or providing only a reactivation function and a mere indication of enabled reactivation function, shall not exceed 1,00 W.

The power consumption of equipment in any condition providing onlyinformation or status display, or providing only a combination ofreactivation function and information or status display, shall not exceed 2,00 W.

The power consumption of equipment in any condition providing only information or status display, or providing only a combination of reactivation function and information or status display shall not exceed 1,00 W.

The power consumption of equipment in any condition providing only a reactivation function, or providing only a reactivation function and a mere indication of enabled reactivation function, shall not exceed 0,50 W.
